question: Pressure of ideal gas at constant volume is proportional to
choices: Average kinetic energy of the molecules
Average potential energy of the molecules
explanation: For an ideal gas, pressure is proportional to temperature (<katex>$P \propto T$</katex>) at constant volume. The total internal energy (which is purely kinetic for ideal gas) is also proportional to <katex>$T$</katex> (<katex>$U \propto T$</katex>). Thus <katex>$P$</katex> is proportional to total energy.
